muTel.daqplotlib.plots package

Submodules

muTel.daqplotlib.plots.Plot module

class muTel.daqplotlib.plots.Plot.CMSPlot(data, *args, plot_cfg=<muTel.daqplotlib.config.PlotConfig>, label_fs=25, tick_pad=10, cms_label='Private Work', cms_loc=0, cms_data=True, cms_rlabel='', cms_exp=False, cms_pad=0, **kwargs)

Bases: Plot

A subclass of muTel.daqplotlib.plots.Plot that provides support for the recommended CMS style using the package ~mplhep.

property cms_kwargs: dict[str, Any]

Get the keyword arguments that will be passed to ~mplhep.cms.label.

class muTel.daqplotlib.plots.Plot.Plot(data, *args, plot_cfg=<muTel.daqplotlib.config.PlotConfig>, figsize=None, label_fs=25, tick_pad=10, **kwargs)

Bases: object

A class used to represent a Plot using the matplotlib library.

__enter__()

Handles the creation in the context manager. If data is not None, this will automatically plot the figure.

Returns:

self – An instances of this class.

Return type:

muTel.daqplotlib.plots.Plot

__exit__(exc_type, exc_value, traceback)

Handles the destruction in the context manager. This will ensure that the figure is closed upon exiting the with statement.

property ax: Axes

Get the ~matplotlib.axis.Axis where the plot will be drawn.

property data: DataFrame

Get the dataset that will be used by the self.plot method.

property fig: Figure

Get the ~matplotlib.figure.Figure where the plot will be drawn.

plot(data, *args, **kwargs)

Method used for drawing the data in ~self.ax. This is a placeholder and should be modified in a subclass for obtaining different plots.

Parameters:

  • data (~pandas.DataFrame or ~pandas.Series) – The set of data that will be used for drawing the plot

  • *args (tuple) – Positional arguments required by the method.

  • **kwargs (dict) – Keyword arguments used by the method.

property plot_cfg: PlotConfig

Get the plot configuration that will be used by the self.plot method.

Module contents

DAQ Plots

This module is based in matplotlib and all the classes defined here have a fig attribute and an ax attribute, which are matplotlib objects.

The module is organized by the matplotlib.pyplot function used to produce the plots, these are the following:

matplotlib

function

hist

Hist

hist2d

Hist2D, BX2D, TDCTime2D

All these classes are derived from CMSPlot which is itself a subclass of Plot.
